intro: Satureja insignis, commonly known as the Mexican thyme, is a perennial herb native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. Its leaves are fragrant and used in traditional medicine for their antiseptic and digestive properties. Satureja insignis thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy plant suitable for both garden cultivation and ecological restoration projects.
